oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tennessee Ernie Ford
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tennessee Ernie Ford at WOPI Studio.

Ernest Jennings Ford (1919-1991), known professionally as Tennessee Ernie Ford, was an American singer and television host who enjoyed success in the country and western, pop, and gospel musical genres. He was born in Bristol. Ford began his radio career as an announcer at WOPI-AM in Bristol. He was also a World War II veteran.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Radio stations; Radio broadcasting; Disc jockeys; Equipment
